page.title: 01 A GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content:
Our area is prodominatly a lowland, rural area with about 15 farmsteads dotted around. Most of the farms are mixed or arable growing cereal crops and specialising in one kind of animal. There are two small villages{Wighill}and{Newton Kyme}each having a population of 200 people.
From the tower of Wighill church, it self being the highest vantage point at 110 feet above sea level, you can see for miles across the valley of the river wharfe. The river winds its way neatly dissecting our area in two. People have lived in this area since ancient times.
A corner of our area contains an underground shopping area and Trading Estate.
